sources.title: Two Rode Together (1961) James Stewart Â· Richard Widmark
sources.description: Two men, a cynically disillusioned U.S. Marshal and an idealistic Army lieutenant, embark on a search for white people who have fallen into the hands of the Comanches. At the end of their bloody journey, they discover that not all of the prisoners are ready to return to civilization.. John Ford's Western often seems like a less consistent, less committed, and less meticulously crafted variation on " The Searchers " ( 1956 ). Remarkable compared to the average of the genre, but unconvincing given its director's stature.

metadata.Plot: The US Army is under pressure from the desperate relatives of white prisoners of the Comanches to secure their rescue. A cynical and corrupt marshal, Guthrie McCabe, is persuaded by an army lieutenant to assist in the negotiations with the Comanches; however, just two captives are released, and their reintegration into white society proves highly problematic.
metadata.Actors: James Stewart, Richard Widmark, Shirley Jones
